p: For the regional model we selected an arid case study in the southeastern Iberian Peninsula (36°58’N, 2°29’W) ( Fig 1C). This region is the most arid in all of Europe and presents the most extreme arid conditions in the specie range. We defined this area based on two criteria: (1) the Martonne aridity index (I a), only including values between 5 and 15 [ 28], (2) the administrative boundaries of the Andalusia ( Fig 1B), because the methodologies employed to obtain environmental GIS cartography (used later to estimate environmental variables for the modeling process) are different across regional administrative boundaries (Spanish Autonomous communities).
